Exhibitions.ExhTitle: French Painting from David to Courbet
Exhibitions.Textblock: French Painting from David to Courbet. The Detroit Institute of Arts, Detroit. 1950.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore; Birmingham Museum of Art, Birmingham; Tacoma Art Museum, Tacoma. 2005-2006.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: A Connoisseur's Portfolio: Nineteenth-century Drawings and Watercolors in the Walters Art Gallery
Exhibitions.Textblock: A Connoisseur's Portfolio: Nineteenth-century Drawings and Watercolors in the Walters Art Gallery. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1983.

Inscriptions: "Alfred Johannot 1831" in lower right; La communion par Alfred Johannot/acheté en décembre 1834 ou février 1835 chez Durand-Ruël/r. n[e] des petits champs no. 103. [?] 400 ff en argent et un dessin/de Gudin évalué 200 ff. total 600 ff. Il est probable que le sujet est/pris de Walter Scott pour les romans du quel les deux frères Johannot/ont beaucoup travaillé. in brown ink, verso; 8 in graphite, verso
Keywords: church; ritual; man; devotion; genre; biblical/religious
Medium: watercolor and graphite underdrawing with white heighteing and gum heightening on cream, moderately thick, moderately textured wove paper
Provenance: Durand-Ruel, Paris, until 1834-35; Sale, Hôtel Drouot, Paris; William T. Walters, Baltimore, 1865, by purchase [George A. Lucas as agent]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1894, by inheritance; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Aged Man Receiving Communion
